sn44.7:1.1: Then the wanderer Vacchagotta went up to Venerable Mahāmoggallāna, and exchanged greetings with him.
sn44.7:1.2: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side, and said to Mahāmoggallāna:
sn44.7:2.1: “Master Moggallāna, is this right: ‘the cosmos is eternal’?”
sn44.7:2.2: “Vaccha, this has not been declared by the Buddha.”
sn44.7:2.4: “Then is this right: ‘the cosmos is not eternal’ …
sn44.7:2.13: ‘the soul and the body are identical’ …
sn44.7:2.16: ‘the soul and the body are different things’ …
sn44.7:2.22: ‘a Realized One doesn’t exist after death’ …
sn44.7:2.25: ‘a Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death’ …
sn44.7:2.28: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death’?”
sn44.7:2.29: “This too has not been declared by the Buddha.”
sn44.7:3.1: “What’s the cause, Master Moggallāna, what’s the reason why, when the wanderers of other religions are asked these questions, they declare one of these to be true?
sn44.7:3.3: And what’s the reason why, when the ascetic Gotama is asked these questions, he does not declare one of these to be true?”
sn44.7:4.1: “Vaccha, the wanderers of other religions regard the eye like this: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self.’ They regard the ear … nose …
sn44.7:4.3: mind like this: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self.’
sn44.7:4.4: That’s why, when asked, they declare one of those answers to be true.
sn44.7:4.7: The Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha regards the eye like this: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’ He regards the ear … nose …
sn44.7:4.9: mind like this: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
sn44.7:4.10: That’s why, when asked, he does not declare one of those answers to be true.”
sn44.7:5.1: Then the wanderer Vacchagotta got up from his seat and went to the Buddha and exchanged greetings with him.
sn44.7:5.2: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side. He asked the Buddha the same questions, and received the same answers.
sn44.7:8.1: He said, “It’s incredible, Master Gotama, it’s amazing!
sn44.7:8.2: How the meaning and the phrasing of the teacher and the disciple fit together and agree without contradiction when it comes to the chief matter!
sn44.7:8.3: Just now I went to the ascetic Mahāmoggallāna and asked him about this matter.
sn44.7:8.4: And he explained it to me with these words and phrases, just like Master Gotama.
sn44.7:8.5: It’s incredible, Master Gotama, it’s amazing!
sn44.7:8.6: How the meaning and the phrasing of the teacher and the disciple fit together and agree without contradiction when it comes to the chief matter!”
